refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mb_detect_order sets automatic character encoding detection order to encoding_list. It returns &true; for success, &false; for failure.
encoding_list is array or comma separated list of character encoding. ("auto" is expanded to "ASCII, JIS, UTF-8, EUC-JP, SJIS")
If encoding_list is omitted, it returns current character encoding detection order as array.
This setting affects mb_detect_encoding and mb_send_mail.

note.para: mbstring currently implements following encoding detection filters. If there is an invalid byte sequence for following encoding, encoding detection will fail.
note.simpara: UTF-8, UTF-7, ASCII, EUC-JP,SJIS, eucJP-win, SJIS-win, JIS, ISO-2022-JP
note.para: For ISO-8859-*, mbstring always detects as ISO-8859-*.
For UTF-16, UTF-32, UCS2 and UCS4, encoding detection will fail always.

example.title: Useless detect order example
example.programlisting:
; Always detect as ISO-8859-1 detect_order = ISO-8859-1, UTF-8
; Always detect as UTF-8, since ASCII/UTF-7 values are ; valid for UTF-8 detect_order = UTF-8, ASCII, UTF-7

example.title: mb_detect_order examples
example.programlisting:
<?php
/* Set detection order by enumerated list */
mb_detect_order("eucjp-win,sjis-win,UTF-8");

/* Set detection order by array */
$ary[] = "ASCII";
$ary[] = "JIS";
$ary[] = "EUC-JP";
mb_detect_order($ary);

/* Display current detection order */
echo implode(", ", mb_detect_order());
?>

refsect1.para: See also mb_internal_encoding, mb_http_input, mb_http_output and mb_send_mail.
